dcc.ufmg.anthill.net
Class SSHHost

java.lang.Object
  dcc.ufmg.anthill.net.SSHHost

public class SSHHost
extends java.lang.Object

This class offers some useful tools for manipulating a remote host via a SSH connection.

Constructor Summary
SSHHost(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String pwd, java.lang.String host)
          Class constructor specifying only the username, the user password and the host address.
SSHHost(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String pwd, java.lang.String host, int port)
          Class constructor specifying the username, the user password, the host address and the SSH port.
 
Method Summary
 void close()
          Close the SSH session with the remote host.
 void downloadFile(java.lang.String remoteFileName, java.lang.String remoteFolderPath, java.lang.String localFolderPath)
          Downloads a file from the remote host into the local host.
 int execute(java.lang.String command)
          Executes a command at the remote host printing on the local host the standard output from the remote host.
 int executeInBackground(java.lang.String command)
          Executes in background a command at the remote host.

Constructor Detail

SSHHost

public SSHHost(java.lang.String user,
               java.lang.String pwd,
               java.lang.String host)
Class constructor specifying only the username, the user password and the host address. This constructor assumes the default SSH port 22.

SSHHost

public SSHHost(java.lang.String user,
               java.lang.String pwd,
               java.lang.String host,
               int port)
Class constructor specifying the username, the user password, the host address and the SSH port. This construction creates a SSH session that connects with the specified host.

Method Detail

close

public void close()
Close the SSH session with the remote host.

executeInBackground

public int executeInBackground(java.lang.String command)
                        throws SSHConnectionLost
Executes in background a command at the remote host. It keeps verifying if the host is still reachable and if the remote host is not reachable it throws an SSHConnectionLost.

Parameters:
command - any valid command to be executed from the ~/ directory.
Returns:
the exit status of the command execution.
Throws:
SSHConnectionLost

execute

public int execute(java.lang.String command)
            throws SSHConnectionLost
Executes a command at the remote host printing on the local host the standard output from the remote host. It keeps verifying if the host is still reachable and if the remote host is not reachable it throws an SSHConnectionLost.

Parameters:
command - any valid command to be executed from the ~/ directory.
Returns:
the exit status of the command execution.
Throws:
SSHConnectionLost

uploadFile

public void uploadFile(java.lang.String localFileName,
                       java.lang.String localFolderPath,
                       java.lang.String remoteFolderPath)
Uploads a file from the local host into the remote host. It creates the remote folder path if it does not exist yet, and then sends to the remote folder path the file specified by the file name and the local folder path.

Parameters:
localFileName - name of the file to be uploaded.
localFolderPath - local folder that contains the file to be uploaded.
remoteFolderPath - remote folder that will receive the file.

downloadFile

public void downloadFile(java.lang.String remoteFileName,
                         java.lang.String remoteFolderPath,
                         java.lang.String localFolderPath)
Downloads a file from the remote host into the local host. It creates the local folder path if it does not exist yet, and then receives the file specified by the file name and the remote folder path.

Parameters:
remoteFileName - name of the file to be downloaded.
remoteFolderPath - remote folder that contains the file to be downloaded.
localFolderPath - local folder that will receive the file.
